Chief Operating Officer Job at Swift Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Swift Consulting Limited - Our client, a Real Estate company, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Operating Officer

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Major Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track operational effectiveness and recommend improvements.
	Represent the company in strategic partnerships, negotiations, and high-level stakeholder engagements
	Provide strategic leadership and direction for daily operations, ensuring alignment with the company’s vision and goals.
	Oversee business functions including property development, sales, marketing, legal, finance, and customer service to ensure smooth coordination and high performance.
	Develop and implement efficient operational processes, systems, and policies to support growth and profitability.
	Drive business expansion strategies, identify new market opportunities, and strengthen competitive positioning.
	Lead, mentor, and motivate teams to deliver high-quality service and meet performance targets.
	Collaborate with the CEO and Board to set strategic priorities, manage risks, and ensure sustainable business growth.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Real Estate, Finance, or a related field (Master’s Degree / MBA is a plus).
	8 - 10 years of senior management experience, preferably within the real estate industry.
	Proven track record of driving operational excellence and business growth.
	In-depth understanding of real estate markets, trends, and regulations.
	Demonstrated ability to build systems, lead teams, and execute large-scale initiatives.
	Strong leadership, strategic thinking, and organizational skills.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and people management abilities.


Salary
N500,000 - N600,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hireme@swiftconsulting.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Social Media Manager Job at Alaba Shonibare & Co.




        
    

        
        Alaba Shonibare & Co. is a leading real estate development and management firm committed to building sustainable communities and redefining property experiences in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for a creative and strategic Social Media Manager to grow our online presence, tell our brand story, and engage audiences across digital platforms.
	The ideal candidate will blend creativity with data-driven insight to promote our projects, facilities, and corporate milestones.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute social media strategies aligned with the company’s marketing and brand objectives.
	Manage and grow the company’s social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, X, TikTok, and YouTube).
	Create compelling and visually appealing content (graphics, videos, reels, posts, and stories) showcasing property developments, facility management services, and corporate milestones.
	Monitor performance metrics, track engagement, and optimize content.
	Collaborate with marketing, sales, and facility teams to ensure consistent messaging.
	Manage community engagement and respond to inquiries promptly.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field.
	2-3 years of experience managing social media for brands (real estate experience is a plus).
	Proficiency in Canva, Adobe Suite, CapCut, and social media management tools.
	Excellent storytelling, copywriting, and analytical skills.
	Creative, detail-oriented, and results-driven.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

  "title": "Human Resources Officer",
  "description": "Zhongxin Network Technology Company Limited is a start-up company that is into sales of computer, phone and accessories.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We&#39;re looking for a proactive and experienced Human Resources Officer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will have at least two years of hands-on experience in the full spectrum of HR functions, with a strong focus on recruitment and compliance.
	This role is crucial for ensuring a positive and productive work environment.


Responsibilities


	You&#39;ll manage the complete recruitment lifecycle, from writing job descriptions and posting ads to screening resumes, interviewing, and making job offers.
	You&#39;ll also handle the onboarding process to ensure new hires are smoothly integrated into the company.
	Act as the main point of contact for employee questions and concerns.
	You&#39;ll be responsible for resolving workplace disputes, addressing grievances, and fostering a positive and healthy work environment.
	You&#39;ll assist with performance reviews and provide guidance to both managers and employees on performance improvement and career development.
	You&#39;ll help administer payroll and manage employee benefits, including health insurance and retirement plans, ensuring compensation is fair and competitive.
	You will develop, implement, and enforce company policies to comply with labor laws and regulations.
	You&#39;ll identify training needs within the company and organize professional development programs to help employees grow their skills.


Requirements


	A Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field is required, and a professional HR certification is a plus.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential for interacting with employees at all levels.
	You must be empathetic and able to handle difficult conversations professionally while building strong relationships with colleagues.
	A solid understanding of Nigerian labor laws and regulations is a must.
	The ability to analyze situations and find effective solutions to workplace issues is key.
	Strong organizational skills are necessary for managing multiple tasks and maintaining accurate, confidential records.
	A high level of integrity is required to handle sensitive information with complete discretion.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrzhongxinnetwork@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Human Resources Officer Job at Zhongxin Network Technology Company Limited




        
    

        
        Zhongxin Network Technology Company Limited is a start-up company that is into sales of computer, phone and accessories.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We're looking for a proactive and experienced Human Resources Officer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will have at least two years of hands-on experience in the full spectrum of HR functions, with a strong focus on recruitment and compliance.
	This role is crucial for ensuring a positive and productive work environment.


Responsibilities


	You'll manage the complete recruitment lifecycle, from writing job descriptions and posting ads to screening resumes, interviewing, and making job offers.
	You'll also handle the onboarding process to ensure new hires are smoothly integrated into the company.
	Act as the main point of contact for employee questions and concerns.
	You'll be responsible for resolving workplace disputes, addressing grievances, and fostering a positive and healthy work environment.
	You'll assist with performance reviews and provide guidance to both managers and employees on performance improvement and career development.
	You'll help administer payroll and manage employee benefits, including health insurance and retirement plans, ensuring compensation is fair and competitive.
	You will develop, implement, and enforce company policies to comply with labor laws and regulations.
	You'll identify training needs within the company and organize professional development programs to help employees grow their skills.


Requirements


	A Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field is required, and a professional HR certification is a plus.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential for interacting with employees at all levels.
	You must be empathetic and able to handle difficult conversations professionally while building strong relationships with colleagues.
	A solid understanding of Nigerian labor laws and regulations is a must.
	The ability to analyze situations and find effective solutions to workplace issues is key.
	Strong organizational skills are necessary for managing multiple tasks and maintaining accurate, confidential records.
	A high level of integrity is required to handle sensitive information with complete discretion.
